intro: Clematis owatarii, commonly known as the Japanese vine, is a deciduous climbing plant native to Japan. It features showy, single or double flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are covered in fine, rusty-colored hairs. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Clematis owatarii is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
